Lots of items found while exploring!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 4 Archive (PS2): Monster Farm 4 (Spoilers!): Reviews, Information on Gameplay, Etc. : Lots of items found while exploring!
By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, September 24, 2003 - 11:58 am:

Just thought I'd note that there are a lot of things you can find while exploring. I have gotten nunchucks, several bottles of potions, a plaid flannel teddy bear, wire-frame glasses with a clown nose attached, a pack of Monster Farm Battle Card CCG cards, a coin, and more. I can see the inventory of them while in the dungeon, I just haven't been able to figure out how to use them!

By Kimochi on Wednesday, September 24, 2003 - 02:40 pm:

That's a lot of items. What is the maximum number of item you can have in the inventory? Is it a fix number just like MR3 or does it get large as you upgrade the ranch?

By Hengar Jell Master on Wednesday, September 24, 2003 - 03:08 pm:

What are the cards for? I don't really mind if you don't know
that yet, but are the like the ones in the monster rancher
card games? And sorry if I ignored the fact that you don't
know how to use them, I just don't know what cards would
be used for and I think it's interesting for cards to be in a
non-spinoff Monster Rancher game. By the way, that's a
cool set of items. I can't wait till the game comes out in
America and we get to find and use those items

By Infernus on Wednesday, September 24, 2003 - 04:37 pm:

Have you tried combining with them? Or can you even use items in combining? O_o

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, September 24, 2003 - 04:49 pm:

I have not been offered the option to use an item in combining yet.

I have also purchased a Wool Ball and a Character Toy (sort of like the dummy Wrackys ask for in MR2) at the item shop, and I have no idea what they are used for, or when. They do not appear in the menu when I feed my monsters.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, September 24, 2003 - 04:51 pm:

Oh yeah, the cards appear as a single pack, with the logo on the back (you cannot rotate the pack) just like we see in the MRBC games. You cannot pull individual cards out. I think it's just a reference back to the card games.

By Raistlin_Majere on Wednesday, September 24, 2003 - 05:12 pm:

the items you get in adventure can be used during free time. you can give them to your monsters. some monsters like toys, books or cards. But i haven't figured out most of the effects when you give these items to your monsters. I only know of one item that's useful it's "Oil oil(?)" which lowers stress :)

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, September 25, 2003 - 11:29 pm:

Ok, I figured it out now. The liquids I have are Rose Perfume and Nageel.
